pressure group based in the United Kingdom. Its formal name is the 'National
Council for Civil Liberties' (NCCL). [http://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/about/structure/agm-
resolutions/constitution-amended-2007.pdf Liberty - Constitution and Rules] | As
amended by the AGM 19 May 2007 Founded in 1934 by Ronald Kidd and Sylvia
Crowther-Smith (later Scaffardi), [http://books.google.-
com/books?id=qps14mSlghcC&pg=PA373&lpg=PA373&dq=ronald+kidd+scaffardi&source=we-
b&ots=2hcIL6FGUa&sig=be6l1WnH6YaqmyjeqnedVxhIYE4#PPA373,M1 Liberty ] | Entry in
the Encyclopedia of British and Irish Political Organisations Liberty
campaigns to protect civil liberties and promote human rights - through the
courts, in Parliament and in the wider community. They do this through a
combination of public campaigning, test case litigation, parliamentary lobbying,
policy analysis and the provision of free advice and information. The aim is to
not only protect civil liberties but also to engender a 'rights culture' within
British society.

Current director of Liberty is Shami Chakrabarti who took the role in September
2003. In 2009, the organisation celebrated 75 years since Ronald Kidd first
founded the National Council for Civil Liberties (NCCL). The event was marked
with a conference which saw some of the UKâs leading thinkers and campaigners
debate the challenges to rights and freedom in modern Britain. [http://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/about/history/75-years-of-
liberty/our-75th-anniversary.php 75 Years of Liberty] | on www.liberty-human-
rights.org.uk
